To have a discussion on adaptive cycles in complex adaptive systems and to compare ecosystems with human systems such as countries, you could invite the following experts:

1. Dr. Brian Walker, a renowned ecologist and expert on resilience and adaptive cycles in ecosystems.
2. Dr. Fikret Berkes, a marine biologist and social scientist who has studied the interaction between human systems and ecosystems, including the adaptive cycles of fishing communities.
3. Dr. Marten Scheffer, a theoretical ecologist who has contributed to the study of early warning signals of tipping points in complex systems, including ecosystems and human systems.
4. Dr. Elinor Ostrom, a political economist who was awarded the Nobel Prize in Economics for her work on the governance of common-pool resources, including forests, fisheries, and irrigation systems.
5. Dr. Peter Haas, a political scientist who has studied the governance of global environmental problems, including the adaptive cycles of international regimes for managing transboundary resources.

These experts would bring a diverse range of perspectives and expertise to the discussion, including ecology, social science, economics, and political science. They would provide insights into the similarities and differences between ecosystems and human systems, as well as the challenges and opportunities for managing the adaptive cycles of complex systems.
